Message.Title: Enormous Gains Ahead
Message.Msg: CCUR, currently $7.89, has 8.754mm s/o, a market cap of $69.07mm, cash of $22.37mm, no debt, and an enterprise value of $46.7mm. CCUR's enterprise value is only 0.74X revenues of $63.23mm, 6.55X operating cash flow of $7.13mm, and 8.34X free cash flow of $5.6mm. CCUR's EPS was up 175% last quarter and it just raised its dividend by 100% to $0.48 per share for a yield of 6.1%. CCUR leads the video on demand (VOD) delivery business with over 2.4mm VOD streams shipped globally and 4 of America's 6 largest cable TV operators as clients. The #2 VOD technology vendor SEAC is currently trading for $11.50 and has an enterprise value of $262.4mm or 1.68X revenues of $156.11mm, 15.05X operating cash flow of $17.43mm, and 19.32X free cash flow of $13.58mm. An enterprise value of 1.68X revenues would value CCUR at $14.69. An enterprise value of 15.05X operating cash flow will value CCUR at $14.81. An enterprise value of 19.32X free cash flow will value CCUR at $14.91. In addition, CCUR provides the #1 Big Data Analytics software solution for cable TV operators. CCUR tracks the customer behavior of 35 million cable TV subscribers across linear TV, VOD, and nDVR and has already processed 15 billion media transactions. Big Data Analytics is the #1 hottest industry on Wall Street. DATA recently had its IPO at $31 and hit a new 52-week high Monday of $63 for a gain of 103%. DATA's enterprise value is currently 25X revenues vs. CCUR's enterprise value of only 0.74X revenues! CCUR's business is booming big time as cable TV service providers upgrade their systems to provide new Network DVR, start-over, and look-back services. CCUR is also powering multi-screen video delivery to tablets, smartphones, and other IP connected devices for major cable TV operators like TWC! Plus, CCUR provides content delivery network (CDN) video solutions and just signed a major CDN contract with Virgin Media, the #1 pay-TV operator in the UK!

Topic.Title: BAC ALREADY HAS DOUBLE THE FED'S NEW 5% LEVERAGE RULE

Message.Msg: As of March 31, BAC's tier 1 common equity ratio was 10.50% and its leverage capital ratio was 7.50%, substantially ahead of the phase schedule in the Fed Reserve's proposed rule. The FDIC is more focused on risk weighted assets -- BAC is all set there too, especially as it continues to derisk the balance sheet and now that profitability is substantially outpacing adjusted asset growth (none) and risk-weighted asset levels (declining by day). BAC ready to rip again... buy all you can afford to spec.

Topic.Title: BAC ALREADY HAS DOUBLE THE FED'S NEW 5% LEVERAGE RULE

Message.Msg: the regulators approved not only a common stock buyback, but also the first chunk -- a serious chunk -- of their expensive preferred shares outstanding. BAC is a great horse to ride this year. As said above, up another 20% from here is an easy call this year, but our upod PT is $20/share as the power of the credit quality turnaround and improving margin set in to valuation. That said, several of even the quality banks will take some hits on the bond market turmoil and related mark to market, but that is already moderating and the impacts on NIM are more important, by an order of magnitude and then some, than non-cash LCM reserves.

Topic.Title: the fastest way to get censored on here...

Message.Msg: They said something about black box saying it was armed as opposed to on or off, whatever that means. I could understand complacency and routine, if they were married to it they may have forgotten to turn it on if something like a student in the cockpit broke their routine. Most of the controlled flight into terrains that I remember were humans distracted with other humans and failure to communicate. A few decades ago, plane in hildin pattern spiralled into ground as crew was obsessed with irrlelvant indicator light and control tower asked the rather open ended question " is everything ok up there?" as they tried to land in a field without the crew realizing it There is always room for improvement and I am probably as conservative as anyone in trusting a machine but compared to humans generally it is worth the effort . I guess with buildings you have better depth perception water IIRC can be tricky- it looks the same at about 1000 as 100 feet. If you are buzzing the building venturi winds and thermals may be a problem, keep a look out for clues from buzzards riding thermals. ROFLMFO.
